Did you have symptoms while on the monitor?  If you did and the only thing noted was the tachycardia, some people do feel tachycardia as palpitations or a skipping sensation.  Even myself at times, and I can usually tell a PAC from a PVC by just the sensation of it.  If I'm exercising hard, a high rate by itself can feel like palpitations.Just a thought.  Glad your monitor looked good though!

I hope you are able to come to grips with your fear. It must be very hard. My only comment about medication is that BB's have very real side effects and are being phased out as first line HTN treatment. So , obviously your doctor is the first person to consult, but BB's have nasty side effects that include inducing diabetes in some people.  My very anxious mother had diabetes after years of Toprol use ( I further suspect her BP only goes up when she's at the doctor) and she is active and weighs only 108 pounds. She should not have type 2 diabetes, neither of her parents had it, so it's not genetic.If one is not "structurally" ill perhaps one should consider discussing alternate therapies for the anxiety with the physician.
